intro: Zexmenia arnottii, commonly known as the slender-flowered zexmenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly aromatic scent when crushed. Zexmenia arnottii typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
